title: Responsive Design with Bootstrap
author: Mark Otto and Jacob Thornton
description: Responsive design is an approach to web design that makes web pages render well on a variety of devices and window or screen sizes. Bootstrap is a popular framework for building responsive, mobile-first websites. This book covers the basics of responsive design and provides an in-depth look at how to use Bootstrap to build responsive web pages.

title: HTML - An Introduction
author: John Doe
description: HTML is the standard markup language used to create web pages. This book provides an introduction to HTML, including the syntax, tags, and attributes used to structure web content. It also covers best practices for writing clean, well-organized HTML code.

title: CSS - An Introduction
author: Jane Smith
description: CSS is used to style web pages and make them look visually appealing. This book provides an introduction to CSS, including the syntax, selectors, and properties used to style HTML elements. It also covers responsive design and best practices for writing maintainable CSS code.

title: JavaScript - An Introduction
author: Bob Johnson
description: JavaScript is a programming language used to create interactive web content. This book provides an introduction to JavaScript, including the syntax, data types, and control structures used in the language. It also covers DOM manipulation, event handling, and best practices for writing clean, maintainable JavaScript code.

title: Web Design with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery Set
author: Jon Duckett
description: This set of three books provides a comprehensive introduction to web design using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery. The books cover the basics of each language and provide practical examples and exercises to help readers build their skills. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced web designer, this set is a must-have resource.
